contextId.information: Mordecai showed disrespect for Haman's status in the government by not doing these actions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: did not kneel and bow down

contextId.information: These acts are signs of severe sadness. AT: "tore his clothes and put on sackcloth and ashes to show his grief" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: tore his clothes and put on sackcloth and ashes

contextId.information: Fasting was a symbolic act that the Jews did when they were praying intensely. This can be made explicit. AT: "fast and pray for me ... will fast and pray" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Rising was a sign of respect. Mordecai did not give Haman special respect. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
People often covered their head to show that they were either extremely sad or ashamed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
